verses.verse: My son, <WH1121> if you have become collateral <WH6148> for your neighbor, <WH7453> if you have struck <WH8628> your hands <WH3709> in pledge for a stranger; <WH2114>
You are trapped <WH3369> by the words <WH561> of your mouth. <WH6310> You are ensnared <WH3920> with the words <WH561> of your mouth. <WH6310>

Do <WH6213> this now, <WH645> my son, <WH1121> and deliver <WH5337> yourself, <WH935> since you have come into the hand <WH3709> of your neighbor. <WH7453> Go, <WH3212> humble <WH7511> yourself. <WH7292> Press your plea with your neighbor. <WH7453>
Give <WH5414> no sleep <WH8142> to your eyes, <WH5869> nor slumber <WH8572> to your eyelids. <WH6079>
Free <WH5337> yourself, <WH6643> like a gazelle from the hand <WH3027> of the hunter, <WH6833> like a bird from the snare <WH3027> of the fowler. <WH3353>
Go <WH3212> to the ant, <WH5244> you sluggard. <WH6102> Consider <WH7200> her ways, <WH1870> and be wise; <WH2449>
which having no chief, <WH7101> overseer, <WH7860> or ruler, <WH4910>
provides <WH3559> her bread <WH3899> in the summer, <WH7019> and gathers <WH103> her food <WH3978> in the harvest. <WH7105>
How long will you sleep, <WH7901> sluggard? <WH6102> When will you arise <WH6965> out of your sleep? <WH8142>
A little <WH4592> sleep, <WH8142> a little <WH4592> slumber, <WH8572> a little <WH4592> folding <WH2264> of the hands <WH3027> to sleep: <WH7901>
so your poverty <WH7389> will come <WH935> as a robber, <WH1980> and your scarcity <WH4270> as an armed <WH4043> man. <WH376>
A worthless <WH1100> person, <WH120> a man <WH376> of iniquity, <WH205> is he who walks <WH1980> with a perverse <WH6143> mouth; <WH6310>
who winks <WH7169> with his eyes, <WH5869> who signals <WH4448> with his feet, <WH7272> who motions <WH3384> with his fingers; <WH676>
in whose heart <WH3820> is perverseness, <WH8419> who devises evil <WH7451> continually, <WH6256> who always <WH6256> sows <WH7971> discord. <WH4066>
Therefore his calamity <WH343> will come <WH935> suddenly. <WH6597> He will be broken <WH7665> suddenly, <WH6621> and that without remedy. <WH4832>
There are six <WH8337> things which Yahweh <WH3068> hates; <WH8130> yes, <WH7651> seven which are an abomination <WH8441> to him: <WH5315>
haughty <WH7311> eyes, <WH5869> a lying <WH8267> tongue, <WH3956> hands <WH3027> that shed <WH8210> innocent <WH5355> blood; <WH1818>
a heart <WH3820> that devises <WH2790> wicked <WH205> schemes, <WH4284> feet <WH7272> that are swift <WH4116> in running <WH7323> to mischief, <WH7451>
a false <WH8267> witness <WH5707> who utters <WH6315> lies, <WH3577> and he who sows <WH7971> discord <WH4090> among brothers. <WH251>
My son, <WH1121> keep <WH5341> your father <WH1>'s commandment, <WH4687> and don't <WH5203> forsake your mother <WH517>'s teaching. <WH8451>
Bind <WH7194> them continually <WH8548> on your heart. <WH3820> Tie <WH6029> them around your neck. <WH1621>
When you walk, <WH1980> it will lead <WH5148> you. <WH7901> When you sleep, it will watch <WH8104> over you. <WH6974> When you awake, it will talk with you. <WH7878>
For the commandment <WH4687> is a lamp, <WH5216> and the law <WH8451> is light. <WH216> Reproofs <WH8433> of instruction <WH4148> are the way <WH1870> of life, <WH1870>
to keep <WH8104> you from the immoral <WH7451> woman, <WH802> from the flattery <WH2513> of the wayward wife <WH5237>'s tongue. <WH3956>
Don't <WH2530> lust after her beauty <WH3308> in your heart, <WH3824> neither let her captivate <WH3947> you with her eyelids. <WH6079>
For a <WH802> prostitute <WH2181> reduces <WH1157> you to a piece <WH3603> of bread. <WH3899> The adulteress <WH802> hunts <WH6679> for your precious <WH3368> life. <WH5315>
Can a man <WH376> scoop <WH2846> fire <WH784> into his lap, <WH2436> and his clothes <WH899> not be burned? <WH8313>
Or can one <WH376> walk <WH1980> on hot coals, <WH1513> and his feet <WH7272> not be scorched? <WH3554>
So is he who goes in <WH935> to his neighbor <WH7453>'s wife. <WH802> Whoever touches <WH5060> her will not be unpunished. <WH5352>
Men don't <WH936> despise a thief, <WH1590> if he steals <WH1589> to satisfy <WH4390> himself <WH5315> when he is hungry: <WH7456>
but if he is found, <WH4672> he shall restore <WH7999> seven <WH7659> times. <WH5414> He shall give all the wealth <WH1952> of his house. <WH1004>
He who commits adultery <WH5003> with a woman <WH802> is void <WH2638> of understanding. <WH3820> He who does <WH6213> it destroys <WH7843> his own soul. <WH5315>
He will get <WH4672> wounds <WH5061> and dishonor. <WH7036> His reproach <WH2781> will not be wiped away. <WH4229>
For jealousy <WH7068> arouses the fury <WH2534> of the husband. <WH1397> He won't <WH2550> spare in the day <WH3117> of vengeance. <WH5359>
He won't <WH5375> regard any ransom, <WH3724> neither will he rest content, <WH14> though you give many <WH7235> gifts. <WH7810>
